data.name: BRCOPY
data.value: Company documents (If applicable)​

data.name: CCMF_Comp_1_A
data.value: Do you presently have a company registered as a legal entity and incorporated in Hong Kong?​

data.name: CCMF_Header
data.value: Cyberport Creative Micro Fund (“CCMF”)​

data.name: CUPP_Header
data.value: Cyberport University Partnership Programme

data.name: CUPP_heading
data.value: Cyberport University Partnership Programme (CUPP) Supported by CCMF​

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_A
data.value: Are you and all of your project management team members listed in Section 4.1 (a) below (if any) between the ages of 18 and 30 upon the application deadline?

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_B
data.value: Are you and all of your project management team members listed in Section 4.1 (a) below (if any) currently enrolled in or have graduated within 3 years from a registered post-secondary education institution in Hong Kong?

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_C
data.value: Is your project rooted in digital tech related areas?

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_D
data.value: Have your proposed project or your other similar digital tech project(s) applied for or received any grant or funding from any publicly and/or privately funded organizations/ programmes in the past 18 months? If “Yes”, please list out in details in Section 4.8 below.

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_E
data.value: Is your proposed project or your other similar digital tech projects applying for, or does your project or your other similar digital tech project(s) anticipates to receiving or to becoming entitled to receive any grant or funding from any publicly and/or privately-funded organizations or programmes in the coming 18 months? If “Yes”, please list out in details in Section 4.8 below.

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_F
data.value: Have your project or your other similar digital tech project(s) applied for the Cyberport Incubation Programme? If “Yes”, please list out in details in Section 4.8 below.

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_G
data.value: If you have answered “yes” to Question 2.1.2 f)​ above, are you applying for the CCMF using the same or similar project under incubation? If similar or different, please clarify with details in Section 4.10 below to enable our Vetting Team to distinguish this application from any others.

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_H
data.value: Are you aware of any existing relationships or situations that might cause the potential for an actual or perceived conflict of interest? If “Yes”, please provide details in Section 4.10 below.

data.name: CUPP_IndComp_2_I
data.value: Please state whether this application is a re-submission of a previously-submitted application to the programme(s) of Cyberport, and / or other publicly-administered funding schemes. If yes, please set out the project reference of the previous application in section 4.10 and highlight the main differences of this application vis-à-vis the previous one.

data.name: HKID
data.value: HKID Card or Identity Proof (if applicable)

data.name: HKP_Pro_Young_Comp_1_A
data.value: Do you presently have a company registered as a legal entity and incorporated in Hong Kong?​

data.name: Instruction_2
data.value: To read the CCMF Guides and Notes for Applicants (ENC.RF.015c) ; before filling in this Application Form, especially part 1, 2 and 3.

data.name: Instruction_4
data.value: If you have another project to apply for CCMF Programme, please use a separate email address for that application.

data.name: Instruction_4_1
data.value:
Please prepare and upload the requested supporting documents in Section 6 including, but not limited to, the following:

  • Company documents (e.g. Business Registration, Certificate of Incorporation, Company Ownership document,etc.) (if applicable)
  • Other supplementary information such as Corporate Structure / Organisation Chart, Curriculum Vitae of team members, pictures, diagrams and business proposal, etc. for illustration of your project (if any)
  • You are recommended to prepare a 1-minute video clip/presentation file/slide show to illustrate your project. Kindly provide the link if there is any.

data.name: Step1_Note
data.value:
Note: The principal applicant of Individual Application must be permanent HKID card holder. Otherwise, please consider submit application as Company Application.
Application eligibility of CCMF is stated in the CCMF Guides and Notes for Applicants (ENC.RF.015c) .

data.name: Step1_Question1_3
data.value: Does your project applying CCMF exceed/not in the early-stage development, for example: launched and generated sustainable revenue, or planning/ going to plan overseas marketing expansion?

data.name: Step2_Note
data.value:
Note: Applicants should make a true, full and accurate disclosure on information requested. The application can be treated as an ineligible application if applicant violates the rule of application. Cyberport has the absolute right to terminate the admitted project due to violation on CCMF rules while applying and within CCMF project period after admission.

If an applicant of the same project applying for Cyberport Creative Micro Fund (CCMF) and Cyberport Incubation Programme (CIP) at the same intake, HKCMCL shall only consider the application of CIP without further notice.

Application eligibility of CCMF Hong Kong Programme is stated in the CCMF Guides and Notes for Applicants (ENC.RF.015c)​.

data.name: Step3_1d_CountryOFOrigin
data.value: Country of Origin​

data.name: Step6_Attachment_Header
data.value: ATTACHMENTS

data.name: Step_3_Smart_Space
data.value: Are you and your company / your team member(s) currently a Cyberport Smart-Space tenant?​

data.name: Step_4_Funding_Statussub
data.value:
(List out in detail (i) all grants and funding received/to be received from other publicly and/or privately funded organizations/ programmes which the applicant (or companies established by he/she/it) has applied for, will receive or will be entitled to receive in the coming 18 months, or have received in the past 18 months; (ii) the nature of expenditure covered/to be covered by such funding sources; and (iii) the amount and the maximum amount received/to be received under such funding sources )

Note: Applicant should make a true, full and accurate disclosure on information requested. The application can be treated as an ineligible application if applicant violates the rule of application. Cyberport has the absolute right to terminate the admitted project due to violation on CCMF rules while applying and within CCMF project period. Application eligibility of CCMF is stated in the CCMF Guides and Notes for Applicants (ENC.RF.015c).

data.name: Step_5_Principal_Applicant
data.value: (Principal Applicant / HK Team Leader)

data.name: Step_6_Consideration
data.value: In consideration of Hong Kong Cyberport Management Company Limited (“HKCMCL”) considering and processing our application for funding from CCMF, we confirm our agreement and undertake the following by checking this box

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_1
data.value: We agree with all the terms and conditions set out in the CCMF Guides and Notes for the Applicants (ENC.RF.035a) governing the application of the Cyberport Creative Micro Fund Scheme.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_2
data.value: All information provided in this application as well as the accompanying information is true, not misleading in any manner and reflects the status of affairs as at the date of submission. I shall inform the Administration of the Cyberport Creative Micro Fund immediately if there are any changes to the above information.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_3
data.value: We are the creators of our proposed project the details of which have been described in Section 3 of this CCMF Application Form ("Project") and our Project is original. To the best of our knowledge, the Project and the product(s) and/or service(s) to be developed as a part of the Project are not under development or available anywhere in the world.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_4
data.value: The development, completion and use of the Project and the product(s) and/or service(s) to be developed as a part of the Project will not infringe the rights or intellectual property rights of any other party (whether registered or not), including but not limited to patent rights, trade mark rights, and copyright.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_5
data.value: Other than the funding programme(s) specified in Section 4.8 of this Application Form, we (whether individually or as part of any team) have not applied for or received any other grant or funding from any publicly and/or privately funded organisations/programmes for the Project in the past 18 months and we are not applying for nor will we be entitled to receive any other grant or funding from any publicly and/or privately funded organisations/programmes for the Project in the future 18 months. We will notify Cyberport immediately if we apply for or become entitled to any grant or funding from any publicly and/or privately funded organisations/programmes for the Project and when requested, provide evidence of payments made or received in respect of such programmes.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_6
data.value: We will use any grant to be received from the CCMF (if any) for the sole purpose of developing and completing the Project. We will not give away, share or otherwise use any grant to be received from the CCMF in contravention of the law or any of the terms which apply to application for funding from the CCMF.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_61
data.value: We will use any grant to be received from the CCMF (if any) for the sole purpose of developing and completing the Project. We will not give away, share or othen/vise use any grant to be received from the CCMF in contravention of the law or any of the terms which apply to application for funding from the CCMF.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_7
data.value: We understand the information provided in this application will be disclosed to authorised Cyberport staff and vetting team for screening and vetting purposes. No Confidential Agreement of any kind will be signed with Cyberport or the authorised Cyberport staff and vetting members on any occasion.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_8
data.value: We give our consent to authorised Cyberport staff to carry out necessary due diligence/reference check for the purpose of assessing this application.

data.name: Step_6_Consideration_9
data.value: We acknowledge that HKCMCL has absolute discretion to revoke this application and call for refund of the full amount of grant received by the applicant if any member of the team breaches any of the terms and conditions in the CCMF Guides and Notes for the Applicants (ENC.RF.015), this CCMF Application Form and any other relevant agreement(s) between us and HKCMCL. If any of our conduct amounts to or may amount to a breach of criminal law, HKCMCL would report our conduct to the relevant law enforcement body.
